com.hemebiotech.analytics

Class AnalyticsCounter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hemebiotech.analytics.AnalyticsCounter

  • public class AnalyticsCounter
extends java.lang.Object

    Class AnalyticsCounter:

    Main Class of the application, AnalyticsCounter contains:
    • the 'public static void main' function,
    • the 'analyticsCounterSupervisor' method.
    Since:
    14-01-2020
    Version:
    v1.5
    Author:
    Alex (Heme Biotech) and Thierry Schreiner (OpenClassrooms student)

    • Constructor Detail

      • AnalyticsCounter

        public AnalyticsCounter()

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception

        Function main:

        Entry point of the program, its only goal is to instance the class and call the analyticsCounterSupervisor() method.

        Parameters:
        args - not used
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - any exception without specific monitoring

      • analyticsCounterSupervisor

        public void analyticsCounterSupervisor()
                                throws java.lang.Exception

        Method analyticsCounterSupervisor:

        This method monitors the application. It calls sequentially each principal function of the program:

        • get the filepath of the file we want to read,
        • read the file,
        • count the occurrences of each symptom,
        • generate the output file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - any exception without specific monitoring

      • chooseAFile

        public java.lang.String chooseAFile()

        Method chooseAFile:

        This method created an instance of the class SelectFileToRead and call its method selectFile() to select a file and get its path.

        Returns:
        a String - the path of the selected file

      • readTheFile

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> readTheFile(java.lang.String filepath)

        Method readTheFile:

        This method created an instance of the class ReadSymptomDataFromFile and call its method getSymptoms() to make a List<String> of its content..

        *
        Parameters:
        filepath - the path of the file to read
        Returns:
        a List<String> - the ArrayList of symptoms read in the file

      • countOccurencesFromArray

        public java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> countOccurencesFromArray(java.util.List<java.lang.String> result)

        Method countOccurencesFromArray:

        This method created an instance of the class CountSymptomsFromArray and call its method countOccurrences() to make a TreeMap<String, Integer> that stores each key with an associated value equal to the number of occurrences of the key in the @param list.

        Parameters:
        result - a List of string with duplicates
        Returns:
        a TreeMap<String, Integer> - the TreeMap that contains the count of symptoms

      • writeATreeMapInATextFile

        public boolean writeATreeMapInATextFile(java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> countResult)

        Method writeATreeMapInATextFile:

        This method created an instance of the class WriteCountResultInFile and call its method writeInFile() to record the given parameter TreeMap<String, Integer> in a text file.

        Parameters:
        countResult - a TreeMap<String, Integer> -
        Returns:
        a boolean - true if the file is written.

      • questionYesOrNo

        public boolean questionYesOrNo(java.lang.String question)

        Method questionYesOrNo:

        This method use java.util.Scanner to ask a yes or no question and wait for a keyboard answer.

        Parameters:
        question - String - the text of the asked question
        Returns:
        boolean - the yes or no answer

      • sendMessage

        public static void sendMessage(int mes)

        Method sendMessage:

        This method centralize console message edition and sending.

        Parameters:
        mes - int - an id associated with a message to print
